oauth.title: Authorized Login
oauth.desp: Authorization means you agree to {appName} reading and using {break} your {avatar}, {email}, and {username}
oauth.token: Read and modify the contents of your issued Fan tickets

app.title: Team Applications
app.desc: Find the API SDK and API set that best suits the app you have in mind, then request to create an instance hosted by your own server. Use the Matataki API to start building your own app. We can't wait to see what you come up with!

member.title: Member Management
member.desc: Here you can see the members of the team.
member.descAdmin: Here you can manage members' permissions and invite and remove members of your team.
member.quit: Sure you want to quit the team?
member.remove: Sure you want to delete this member?
member.invitePlace: Search for a member's nickname, or email address

team.title: Team Management
team.desc: If collaborating with others to create your application instance is the way to go, then creating the right team is the way to go, create a team named and managed by you below!

new.title: Create a new Vault
new.desc: Enter your key name and key value below

setting.title: Vault
desc: Here you can create and use some simple key-value pairs that will only be allowed to be retrieved if both Client ID and Client Secret are provided, along with the user Token (optional).
These key-value pairs are stored as equivalent to passwords, you can only store the strings and keep them on the server side as "keys" attached to the API for use.
We do not check what you store, your privacy is ensured and can only be accessed if you provide us with a Client ID and Client Secret.

update.title: Update your Vault
update.desc: Enter your key name and key value below

app.title: Application List
app.desc: Find the API SDK and API set that best suits the app you have in mind, then request to create an instance hosted by your own server. Use the Matataki API to start building your own app. We can't wait to see what you come up with!

noti.title: Notification List
noti.desc: Here is the notification list, where all invitations and updates are displayed.

oaset.title: OAuth 2 Settings
oaset.desc: Please link your website to the following address to use OAuth login

opc.title: OAuth Permission Control
opc.desc: Here you can control what permissions your App requests, or force some data access permissions.
opc.creator: Modify collaborator permissions
opc.number: Modification of the number of additional issues
opc.forProfile: Permissions for the content of account information
